title: The Name of the Wind
author: Patrick Rothfuss
description: An epic tale of a legendary hero telling his own story, filled with beautiful prose and intricate world-building that will keep you turning pages.
reason: Shares the same blend of rich world-building and a compelling protagonist driven by curiosity and talent.

title: Piranesi
author: Susanna Clarke
description: A man lives in a labyrinthine house filled with statues and tides, slowly unraveling the secrets of his strange reality in this mesmerizing puzzle of a novel.
reason: Offers the same sense of mystery and discovery, with an unreliable narrator piecing together a surprising truth.

title: Anxious People
author: Fredrik Backman
description: A botched bank robbery leads to a hostage situation in an apartment showing, weaving together the deeply human stories of everyone involved.
reason: Delivers the same emotional depth and ensemble cast, where flawed characters reveal surprising humanity.

title: Mexican Gothic
author: Silvia Moreno-Garcia
description: A glamorous socialite travels to a crumbling mansion in the Mexican countryside to rescue her cousin and uncovers a dark, centuries-old secret.
reason: Shares the same atmospheric tension and a sharp-witted protagonist uncovering sinister secrets.

title: The Martian
author: Andy Weir
description: An astronaut is stranded alone on Mars and must use science and ingenuity to survive until a rescue mission can reach him, told with wit and technical precision.
reason: Delivers the same page-turning plot and a resourceful protagonist solving problems under pressure.

title: Eleanor Oliphant Is Completely Fine
author: Gail Honeyman
description: A deeply lonely woman with a painful past navigates modern life with rigid routines until an unexpected friendship begins to crack open her carefully constructed world.
reason: Shares the same darkly comic voice and a deeply compelling character whose inner life slowly reveals itself.
